New Records: Lautaro Martínez is the Copa America’s top scorer with nine goals (two in 2019, three in 2021, four in 2024) since his debut in the 2019 CONMEBOL Copa América
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored twice in the second half to help Argentina win 2-0 against Peru
Leandro Paredes missed a penalty for Argentina
Argentina had a goal disallowed in the 23rd minute due to an offside position
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina were already into the quarter-finals with a game to spare
Argentina were without talisman Lionel Messi due to a groin injury
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni will be hoping they can go one better and defend their title this time around
Peru have been eliminated from the tournament with just one point to their name, the first time they have been eliminated without a single victory since 1995
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina averaged 74% possession against Peru, matching their second-highest possession rate in the CONMEBOL Copa América since at least the 2011 edition

Argentina concluded their participation in the group stage of the 2024 CONMEBOL Copa América with three wins in three matches, without conceding any goals while scoring all their goals after half-time
